STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 27, 2021
Mark Kwarciany, Director
Delta/Dickinson/Menominee DHHS
305 Ludington
Escanaba, MI 49829
RE: License #: CP210201090
Delta/Dickinson/Menominee DHHS
305 Ludington
Escanaba, MI 49829
Dear Mr. Kwarciany
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 09/09/2021.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Implementation Sustainability, and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days
from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
PLEASE SUBMIT YOUR CORRECTIVE ACTION PLAN VIA EMAIL TO
CLAUDIA TRIESTRAM AT triestramc@michigan.gov
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact Claudia Triestram,
Area Manager at (616) 552-3662 with any questions.
Sincerely,
Don Collier, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-5326
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1).The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for:
R 400.12205 Required staff.
(3) An agency shall report any change of chief administrator
by the next business day to the department.
Mark Kwarciany replaced Susan Asplund as agency director on August 9, 2021. The
agency failed to notify the Division of Child Welfare Licensing as required by the
above rule.
A “change” Child Placing Agency Application will need to be submitted to Sarah
Gorby at GorbyS@michigan.gov and fingerprinting will need to be arranged.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
There were no additional MISEP violations.
3.) Please note that there are additional DHHS Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Policy
requirements.
The were no additional DHHS policy violations.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
No technical assistance was required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request or require consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
4

maltreatment during this licensing period which was approved on 09/22/2020 with
noncompliance’s as follows:
CPA405(5)(a)(b) Change of Placement Documentation
SRM 200 Fingerprint Training
There were no repeat violations.
VII. CHIEF ADMINISTRATOR ASSESSMENT
The Chief Administrator Assessment was completed on 09/08/2021 by Mark
Kwarciany. It showed a thorough review of foster care services files and adoption
files and a corrective action plan to resolve what he had found.
Interviews
The supervisor and foster care workers interviewed felt supported and are provided
the tools they need to perform their role.
VIII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
IX. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
September 27, 2021
________________________________________
Don Collier Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 27, 2021
_______________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
